item.name: User
Signup

response.name: signup-error 400

item.description: The Signup API allows new users to create an account in the Uniformis Shoppe e-commerce application. This endpoint collects essential user information such as name, email, phone number, and password. Upon successful registration, the user is added to the database, and a unique user_id is assigned.

item.name: login
item.description: The Sign-in page of the Uniformis e-commerce application allows registered users to access their accounts by entering their credentials.

item.name: Forgot_password

response.name: error 400

item.description: The Forgot Password feature allows users who have forgotten their password to request an OTP (One-Time Password) sent to their registered email. This OTP can be used to reset their password.

item.name: Home_page

response.name: Home

item.description: Home Page which displays items based on catefory.

item.name: Product_details

response.name: product-page-success 200

item.description: This page return the product details, customer reviews, and similar products (for recommendations).

item.name: Cart
item.description: This allows the users to add items to their cart.

item.name: Wishlist
item.description: This sections allows the items to be added to wishlist for later reference

item.name: orders

response.name: order_error

item.description: This request will be used to retrieve all orders placed by a specific user, including order details and their items

item.name: Review

response.name: New Request

item.description: User would be allowed to add review to a prduct form this section

item.name: Offer_page

response.name: offerpage

item.description: This page will showcase the offers that are available

item.name: Wallet

response.name: Add_money-error

item.description: This endpoint will allow users to add money to their wallet using different payment methods.

item.name: contact_us

response.name: contact_error 400

item.description: This API endpoint allows users to submit a contact form. The form includes details such as name, email, subject, and a message description.
This part includes the documentation of the user side api
